info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 11:11PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Brown County through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bangs, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownwood, Early, Bangs, Blanket, Lake Brownwood Near Thrifty, Lake Brownwood, Zephyr, Byrds, Grosvenor, Lake Brownwood State Park, Camp Bowie, Owens and Thrifty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
